nub.processing

Class TimingTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • nub.timing.Task
      • nub.processing.TimingTask

  • public abstract class TimingTask
extends Task
    Timing tasks are (non)recurrent, (non)concurrent (see Task.isRecurrent() and Task.isConcurrent() resp.) callbacks defined by overridden Task.execute().

    A timing task runs (see Task.run(long)) at a certain Task.period() which define the interval duration between two consecutive executions (see also Task.frequency()). Do not use the task for drawing since it will not necessarily run every frame.

    Call Graph.unregisterTask(Task) to cancel the task.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TimingTask(Scene scene)
      Constructs a sequential recurrent task with a Task.period() of 40ms (i.e., a Task.frequency() of 25 Hz).

      Deactivates the task.

        public void run()
        Description copied from class: Task
        Runs the task according to Task.period(). The timer may be scheduled for repeated fixed-rate execution according to Task.isRecurrent().

      • enableConcurrence

        public void enableConcurrence(boolean enable)
        Description copied from class: Task
